___ male with a past medical history of COPD on 2L at night, chronic back pain who presents for evaluation of melena. 

The patient reports that for the past 6 weeks, he has 
experienced worsening back pain and left-sided sciatica for which she has been taking 800 mg of ibuprofen 3 times daily combined with multiple daily Aleve. 

Today, he noted about ___ bowel movements which were first 
watery but then dark red. Symptoms were associated with some
lightheadedness. No chest pain or pressure. He was evaluated by his PCP today and found to be hypotensive to ___. EMS was was called and he was takento the ED, receiving 400 cc of fluid en route with improvement in his blood pressure. 

Patient is not on any beta blockade or blood thinner. No large alcohol use. No previous history of GI bleeding. No known
esophageal varices or liver disease.
